title: Root URL trailing slash
body:
I've created a functional test which checks for the following:

    $I->seeCurrentRouteIs('projects.index');

However when I run this test I get the following:

    1) Failed to user can delete project in ProjectsTestCest::userCanDeleteProject (tests/functional/ProjectsTestCest.php)
    
     Step  I see current route is "projects.index"
     Fail  Failed asserting that two strings are equal.
    --- Expected
    +++ Actual
    @@ @@
    -'/'
    +''

If I change my test to check for:

    $I->seeCurrentUrlEquals('');

This test passes. If possible I'd still like to check for the current route as it keeps my testing more dynamic.

Have tried setting `root` the following in `tests/functional.suite.yml` to no avail:

    class_name: FunctionalTester
    modules:
        enabled:
            - Helper\Functional
            - Asserts
            - Laravel5:
                environment_file: .env.testing
                root: /

Route is defined as follows:

    Route::get('/', [
        'as'   => 'projects.index',
        'uses' => 'ProjectController@index'
    ]);

title: Select radio button by label with PhpBrowser
body:
If I have a dropdown like the following:
```
<label for="gender">Gender</label>
<select name="gender" id="gender">
	<option value="female">Female</option>
	<option value="male">Male</option>
</select>
```
When writing a test and using PhpBrowser I can select an option by the label as follows:
```
$I->selectOption('Gender', 'Female');
```
How could I do the same with radio buttons?

If I was able to do this, I believe PhpBrowser and WebDriver can share the same code if there are no js interactions.

body:
When i tried to switch to Iframe, it says Unable to switch framework,   I tried to switch frame using index and name, but it was not working
$I->switchToIFrame(1)

Then i tried to find name of iframe (since name is dynamic), then it says like xpath is not definied

I am using Webdriver module, not selenium driver with latest version of codeception 

Anyone please help me

title: Suggesstion: Add option to amOnPage() for using POST
body: This is to simulate browser link clicks that result in a POST requests. The REST module's `sendPost()` function could be used as a workaround to that but I believe logically it's not the logical approach besides it would not work right if both an API with a different root URL need to be tested too (e.g. the website is at `http://localhost/` while the REST API is at `http://localhost/api/`). The type could be a second function parameter that defaults to `GET`.

title: Can't upload file with codeception
[Question]: Is there any ability to use helpers from suite within dataProvider for some tests?
Cept tests ignoring environment
body:
I have two environments set up: one for PhpBrowser and one for WebDriver.  My acceptance.suite.yml file is as follows:

```
class_name: WebGuy
modules:
    enabled:
        - PhpBrowser
        - WebHelper
        - Db
    config:
        PhpBrowser:
            url: http://alpha.test.local/

env:
    phantom:
        modules:
            enabled:
                - WebDriver
                - WebHelper
                - Db
            config:
                WebDriver:
                    url: http://alpha.test.local/
                    browser: phantomjs
                    window_size: 1024x768
    browser:
```

However, even when including `$scenario->env('browser');` in the code for Cept tests, the tests still run when the "phantom" environment is specified.  For example:

```
php ./vendor/bin/codecept run acceptance UserController --env phantom
Codeception PHP Testing Framework v2.1.2
Powered by PHPUnit 4.8.6 by Sebastian Bergmann and contributors.

Acceptance-phantom Tests (2) -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Reset database and edit password (PasswordCept)                                                                                           Ok
Reset database and edit username (UsernameEditCept)                                                                                       Ok
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
DEPRECATION: reset database and edit password | $scenario->env() is deprecated in favor of annotation: // @env
DEPRECATION: reset database and edit username | $scenario->env() is deprecated in favor of annotation: // @env
```

Changing to `// @env browser` -- as suggested by the deprecation message -- also does not work, however.

So how can I ensure that Cept tests only run under the specified environment?

title: Make test suite path more configurable
body:
Hi, 

Is codeception support to customize test suite path?

for example:

I have this configuration:


```
class_name: FunctionalTester
modules:
    enabled:
        # add framework module here
        - Yii1
        - \Helper\Functional
        - PhpBrowser
        - Db
    config:
        Yii1:
            appPath: '/Volumes/disk0s4/www/new-proj/trunk/test.php'
            url: 'https://my.proj.local/test.php'
        PhpBrowser:
            url: 'https://my.proj.local/'
        Db:
            dsn: 'mysql:host=127.0.0.1;dbname=test-proj-new'
            user: 'root'
            password: 'root'
            ...
```

at `config` > `Yii1` > `appPath` is fixed path which my own local configuration. unfortunately if someone in my team want to setup his own test, this configuration won't work, instead he need to setup new suite for it. as I know each suite will have its own test-file.

What I expect is everyone can have own-suite-configuration, but keep to run the same test-file.

So, do you have any idea to handle the kind of this situation? I really appreciate all of your input and thanks a lot for attention.

body:

```
coverage:
    enabled: true

        - controller/*

```

The HTML coverage report show `appinfo/info.xml` at 0% coverage

title: Codeception (or Guzzle?) does not appear to correctly send a cookie if the name contains square brackets
$I->click submit in wordpress is not working.
body:
After upgrading to 2.1, When using acceptance tests in wordpress, and I am unable to see that my settings have been saved after clicking the Save button.
It seems like the $I->click command is not working as expected, when I am trying to publish a post. 

The click command is working fine in other contexts, like navigating between "Posts", and "Pages". This  is working as expected. Clicking the publish/update button in posts or pages is also working fine, it is just when I am changing settings.

I reverted back to codeception 2.0.16 but the issue is still persisting.  I reverted back to 2.0.12 and it started working again. Phew!

Thanks in advance 

Cloud

title: Error using the default SPL autoloader
body:
Hi,
When attempting to use `spl_autoload_register();` in `_bootstrap.php` I have found that Codeception is unable to find the required application classes. However, executing `>tests\_bootstrap.php`directly yields no problems. Upon further investigation I have noticed that this  is specifically a problem with the PHAR file in this project.

I was able to correct the problem by [entering this code](https://nxsys.assembla.com/spaces/onx/snippets/29413) in to `_bootstrap.php` (followed by `spl_autoload_register();` of course).

Considering that the default implementation of SPL Autoload should the implementation of first (last?) resort, this shim should be installed sometime before `_bootstrap.php`.

-Thanks!

Environment
PHP 5.6.9
Codeception 2.1.1

title: Add server-side event parsing to the REST module
body: It would be great if we could parse responses sent by server-side events (EventSource). Each event contains JSON data, but the JSON parser chokes on the identifier.

title: Codeception doesn't work on HHVM
body:
I am creating this ticket to track all HHVM related issues.

1. Blocking issue: https://github.com/facebook/hhvm/issues/5786
HHVM can't generate helper classes because it doesn't see methods imported by https://github.com/Codeception/Codeception/blob/856734a2aadd38d1a8fb93f21e2aa37c774546bf/src/Codeception/Module/Asserts.php#L11 HHVM can run tests if there is no need to regenerate helper classes.

2. Non-blocking issue: https://github.com/facebook/hhvm/issues/5790 it prints quite a lot of garbage for Codeception test suite, but it doesn't affect our users.

3. Code coverage result differs from PHP: https://github.com/facebook/hhvm/issues/1589

title: Double I in html scenarios
Show variable value instead of variable name when running generate:scenarios.
body:
That applies to variables defined in the test class and variables coming from PageObjects.

When generating scenarios:

`$I->see(Login::$loginButton);`

becomes

`I see "Login::$loginButton"`

Works correctly when running the tests:

`$I->see(Login::$loginButton);`

becomes

`I see "Login and access dashboard"`

title: [Acceptance] [InnerBrowser] Sending unchecked checkboxes
body:
As of now, the following doesn't work in Codeception acceptance tests:

In browsers, if you submit a form with these fields:
```html
<input type="hidden" name="terms" value="No">
<input type="checkbox" name="terms" value="Yes">
```
* If the checkbox is **not checked**, the **hidden field** will be sent.
* If the checkbox **is** checked, this one will be sent, since it's the last occurrence of the field named `terms`.

Codeception is not reproducing this browser default behaviour. The `terms` param is not being included in the request when the checkbox is unchecked.

This is a pretty common practice amongst frameworks like CakePHP.

title: Preload tests before checking environments; fixes #2032
body: It is aimed to fix #2032. I have only tested it locally and looks like it works.

title: Replace Filesystem, FTP with FlySystem in order to support more filesystems
body:
"[FlySystem](http://flysystem.thephpleague.com/) is a filesystem abstraction which allows you to easily swap out a local filesystem for a remote one. Reducing technical debt and chance of vendor lock-in."

It could replace the custom FileSystem and FTP modules and offer support for many more filesystems. Here is a list of what's available today :
* Local
* Azure
* AWS S3 V2
* AWS S3 V3
* Copy.com
* Dropbox
* FTP / SFTP
* GridFS
* Memory
* Rackspace
* WebDAV
* PHPCR
* ZipArchive

### The API
http://flysystem.thephpleague.com/api/

#### Write Files

`$filesystem->write('path/to/file.txt', 'contents');`

#### Update Files

`$filesystem->update('path/to/file.txt', 'new contents');`

#### Write or Update Files

`$filesystem->put('path/to/file.txt', 'contents');`

#### Read Files

`$contents = $filesystem->read('path/to/file.txt');`

#### Check if a file exists

`$exists = $filesystem->has('path/to/file.txt');`

#### Delete Files

`$filesystem->delete('path/to/file.txt');`

#### Read and Delete

`$contents = $filesystem->readAndDelete('path/to/file.txt');`

#### Rename Files

`$filesystem->rename('filename.txt', 'newname.txt');`

#### Copy Files

`$filesystem->copy('filename.txt', 'duplicate.txt');`

#### Get Mimetypes

`$mimetype = $filesystem->getMimetype('path/to/file.txt');`

#### Get Timestamps

`$timestamp = $filesystem->getTimestamp('path/to/file.txt');`

#### Get File Sizes

`$size = $filesystem->getSize('path/to/file.txt');`

#### Create Directories

`$filesystem->createDir('path/to/nested/directory');`

#### Directories are also made implicitly when writing to a deeper path

`$filesystem->write('path/to/file.txt', 'contents');`

#### Delete Directories

`$filesystem->deleteDir('path/to/directory');`

title: PhantomJS webdriver can't connect to localhost server in Travis-CI env
body:
### Env
Travis container
PHP 5.4-5.6
Codeception 2.1.2
codeceptionbuiltinwebserver or php -S
phantomjs 1.9.8 or 2.0.0


### Config
```
class_name: AcceptanceTester
modules:
    enabled:
         - \Helper\Acceptance
         - WebDriver:
             url: http://localhost:8000
             browser: phantomjs
             window_size: 960x1080
             capabilities:
                 unexpectedAlertBehaviour: 'accept'
```

```
$ phantomjs --webdriver=4444 --ignore-ssl-errors=true --webdriver-loglevel=DEBUG &
$ curl http://localhost:4444/wd/hub/status
[DEBUG - 2015-08-10T22:33:45.461Z] RouterReqHand - _handle - {"headers":{"Accept":"*/*","Host":"localhost:4444","User-Agent":"curl/7.22.0 (x86_64-pc-linux-gnu) libcurl/7.22.0 OpenSSL/1.0.1 zlib/1.2.3.4 libidn/1.23 librtmp/2.3"},"httpVersion":"1.1","method":"GET","url":"/status","urlParsed":{"anchor":"","query":"","file":"status","directory":"/","path":"/status","relative":"/status","port":"","host":"","password":"","user":"","userInfo":"","authority":"","protocol":"","source":"/status","queryKey":{},"chunks":["status"]}}
```

So when I run the tests on FreeBSD, there is no issue. I can also launch selenium and use phantomjs as the browser and get tests to pass.

In a Travis-CI container however, only Selenium + Firefox works. As soon as the browser is set to `phantomjs`, then the acceptance tests fail because ghostdriver can't connect to `http://localhost:8000`

I can connect to `http://localhost:8000` using curl just fine.

### Logs

```
* I am on page "/"
  [GET] http://localhost:8000/
[DEBUG - 2015-08-10T21:56:19.387Z] RouterReqHand - _handle - {"headers":{"Accept":"application/json","Content-Length":"35","Content-Type":"application/json;charset=UTF-8","Host":"127.0.0.1:4444"},"httpVersion":"1.1","method":"POST","post":"{\"url\":\"http:\\/\\/localhost:8000\\/\"}","url":"/session/a195afc0-3faa-11e5-bcf1-6dcfc240368c/url","urlParsed":{"anchor":"","query":"","file":"url","directory":"/session/a195afc0-3faa-11e5-bcf1-6dcfc240368c/","path":"/session/a195afc0-3faa-11e5-bcf1-6dcfc240368c/url","relative":"/session/a195afc0-3faa-11e5-bcf1-6dcfc240368c/url","port":"","host":"","password":"","user":"","userInfo":"","authority":"","protocol":"","source":"/session/a195afc0-3faa-11e5-bcf1-6dcfc240368c/url","queryKey":{},"chunks":["session","a195afc0-3faa-11e5-bcf1-6dcfc240368c","url"]}}
[DEBUG - 2015-08-10T21:56:19.388Z] SessionReqHand - _postUrlCommand - Session 'a195afc0-3faa-11e5-bcf1-6dcfc240368c' is about to load URL: http://localhost:8000/
[DEBUG - 2015-08-10T21:56:19.389Z] Session [a195afc0-3faa-11e5-bcf1-6dcfc240368c] - page.onResourceRequested - {"headers":[{"name":"User-Agent","value":"Mozilla/5.0 (Unknown; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/534.34 (KHTML, like Gecko) PhantomJS/1.9.8 Safari/534.34"},{"name":"Accept","value":"text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,*/*;q=0.8"}],"id":1,"method":"GET","time":"2015-08-10T21:56:19.389Z","url":"http://localhost:8000/"}
[DEBUG - 2015-08-10T21:56:19.389Z] Session [a195afc0-3faa-11e5-bcf1-6dcfc240368c] - _oneShotCallback - onLoadStarted
[DEBUG - 2015-08-10T21:56:19.392Z] Session [a195afc0-3faa-11e5-bcf1-6dcfc240368c] - page.onResourceError - {"errorCode":1,"errorString":"Connection refused","id":1,"url":"http://localhost:8000/"}
```

title: Make getScenerio public
body: @DavertMik, is there a reason for $actor->getScenario to be protected? Can it be made public?

title: InvalidCookieDomainException when (automatically) adding a 3rd-party cookie via a session snapshot
body:
When loading a session snapshot, **every** previously saved cookie will be added individually. When adding, lets say a 3rd-party ad cookie with the domain ```.foo.com``` (and my configured URL is ```.bar.com```), an ```InvalidCookieDomainException``` will be thrown since the cookie domain does not match the current site url. The [HttpCommandExecutor](https://github.com/facebook/php-webdriver/blob/community/lib/Exception/WebDriverException.php#L139) throws a ```\Facebook\WebDriver\Exception\WebDriverException``` based on the return code ```24```.

Im not sure what to do here. Am I misunderstanding something or should the [WebDriver](https://github.com/Codeception/Codeception/blob/2.1/src/Codeception/Module/WebDriver.php#L2144) only accept Cookies that match the host part of the configured URL? The [WebDriverOptions](https://github.com/facebook/php-webdriver/blob/community/lib/WebDriverOptions.php#L42-L43) class documents to only add cookies with a domain value of ```null``` or the same host as the configured URL.

In my case the ad cookie prevents me from loading session snapshots. Please let me know what you think about this, I would gladly create a PR if something I wrote here makes any sense :)

title: unable to get the data from database in laravel5 using codeception
seeLink does not match exactly
body: When writing tests with `seeLink` does not perform exact pattern match on the URL path. It matches a link that simply _contains_ the pattern, rather than looking for a link that matches exactly. So for example, if we have `About` (and that is the only link with the content "About"), `$I->seeLink('About', '/');` will match. The documentation states that [the pattern will match exactly](http://codeception.com/docs/modules/PhpBrowser#seeLink). The [XPath only does a `contains` match](https://github.com/Codeception/Codeception/blob/2.1/src/Codeception/Lib/InnerBrowser.php#L207), though. I'm not sure if this is the intended behavior, and the documentation is wrong, or vice-versa. (PHP 5.5.9, Codeception 2.1.1)

title: No way to wait for a field to get focus
body:
I'm having a problem with loading a form via AJAX. I wait for the form element to appear and then submit the form. The problem is that once the form is loaded the username gets focus and this interrupts the webdriver whilst it is in the middle of filling out another field.
I tried $I->waitForJS("$('#register-form-username').is('focus')", 30); but that didn't work.
I'm currently using a regular wait method but would prefer something that doesn't waste time.
This only seems to be a problem with PhantomJS so far and not Selenium.
